title: Setting Up 750 Grain Drill for Kernza

tasks.task: Set up a grain drill for planting Kernza perennial wheatgrass seed.
Adjust the drill's seed metering settings.
subtasks: Determine the appropriate depth and spacing for the grain drill.
Adjust the seed cups and open them as needed for the small seed size.
Balance the seed metering settings on both sides of the drill.

tasks.task: Calculate seed rate and prepare for accurate planting.
subtasks: Determine the required seed rate for 24 acres.
Weigh the pure live seed to calculate the amount needed per acre.
Track seed weight using bags and a scale during setup.

tasks.task: Fine-tune the drill’s speed and seed rate.
subtasks: Use GPS and set the drill’s speed to replicate real-time conditions.
Adjust the seed metering settings based on field trials and GPS results.

tasks.task: Ensure proper engagement of the drill’s mechanical components.
subtasks: Operate pressure valves and adjust clutch plates.
Connect the outer shaft to the gearbox using a chain.
Remove half-speed gears using an air hammer and chisel.
Replace a roll pin with an air hammer for the spur gear mechanism.
